"**Say You Won 't Let Go**" is a song by British singer and songwriter [James
Arthur](/wiki/James_Arthur "James Arthur"). The song was released as a
[digital download](/wiki/Music_download "Music download") on 9 September 2016
in the United Kingdom by [Columbia Records](/wiki/Columbia_Records "Columbia
Records") as the lead single from his second studio album _[Back from the
Edge](/wiki/Back_from_the_Edge "Back from the Edge")_ (2016).[1] The single
peaked at the top of the [UK Singles Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles
Chart"), a position it maintained for three weeks. Outside the United Kingdom,
the single has topped the charts in Australia, New Zealand, Sweden and the
Republic of Ireland. It also became his breakthrough hit in the US, peaking at
number 11 on the [_Billboard_ Hot 100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot
100").

## Commercial
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Say_You_Won%27t_Let_Go&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Commercial performance")]

On 12 September 2016, the song was at number 30 on _[The Official Chart
Update](/wiki/The_Official_Chart#The_Official_Chart_Update "The Official
Chart")_ in the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom "United Kingdom").[2][3]
On 16 September 2016, the song entered the [UK Singles
Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart") at number 25, and peaked at
number one two weeks later, spending three consecutive weeks at the top. The
song was ranked the nineteenth biggest-selling song of 2016 in the UK, making
Arthur the biggest-selling British male artist of the year.[4] By the second
week of January 2017, it had surpassed the one million sales mark, making him
the first-ever _X Factor_ act to have two singles sell over a million copies
in his homeland.[5] Controversy arose when similarities to [The
Script](/wiki/The_Script "The Script")'s "[The Man Who Can't Be
Moved](/wiki/The_Man_Who_Can%27t_Be_Moved "The Man Who Can't Be Moved")" were
found, yet the Script ultimately decided not to pursue legal action.[6]
Listeners also think that it has plagiarised the chorus in [Adele](/wiki/Adele
"Adele")'s [Someone like You](/wiki/Someone_like_You_\(Adele_song\) "Someone
like You \(Adele song\)").[7] In early March, it had gone double platinum in
the UK.[8]

In the United States, the song is his first single to chart on the US
[_Billboard_ Hot 100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100"), making
Arthur only the second winner of _The X Factor UK_ to reach the US top 40
(following [Leona Lewis](/wiki/Leona_Lewis "Leona Lewis")) and only the third
winner to chart on the Hot 100 following Lewis and [Little
Mix](/wiki/Little_Mix "Little Mix"). In May 2017, the song reached No. 1 on
the Adult Pop Songs Airplay Chart, more than six months after its release in
the US.[9] The song was also certified platinum in the US by the RIAA on May
18, 2017.[10] The song has sold over 1,208,000 digital copies in the US as of
September 2017.[11] It was the eighth best-selling song of 2017 in the US,
with 1,195,000 copies sold in 2017.[12]

On 15 September 2016, the song entered the [Irish Singles
Chart](/wiki/Irish_Singles_Chart "Irish Singles Chart") at number 91 before
peaking at number one on 14 October and spending four non-consecutive weeks at
the top of the charts. The song has also charted in
[Australia](/wiki/Australia "Australia"), [France](/wiki/France "France"),
[New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand "New Zealand") and [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden
"Sweden"). On February 26, 2017, it was announced on Channel 4's _[Sunday
Brunch](/wiki/Sunday_Brunch "Sunday Brunch")_ that the single had sold 2
million copies worldwide.[13]

## Music
video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Say_You_Won%27t_Let_Go&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Music video")]

A music video to accompany the release of "Say You Won't Let Go" was first
released onto YouTube on 9 September 2016 at a total length of three minutes
and thirty seconds.[14]
